Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a Redis cluster command executor in Java that handles command execution with retry logic, connection management, and error handling for a Redis cluster environment.

Class Description: ClusterCommandExecutor is a Redis cluster command executor that provides functionality to execute commands across a Redis cluster with support for retries, connection pooling, and handling of various Redis cluster-specific exceptions.

Attributes:
- provider: ClusterConnectionProvider - Manages connections to the Redis cluster nodes
- maxAttempts: int - Maximum number of retry attempts for command execution
- maxTotalRetriesDuration: Duration - Maximum duration for all retry attempts
- log: Logger - Logger instance for debugging and error logging

Methods:
- close() -> void - Closes the connection provider and releases resources
- broadcastCommand(CommandObject<T> commandObject) -> T - Executes a command across all nodes in the cluster and collects responses/errors
- executeCommand(CommandObject<T> commandObject) -> T - Executes a command on the primary node with retry logic
- executeCommandToReplica(CommandObject<T> commandObject) -> T - Executes a command on a replica node with retry logic
- doExecuteCommand(CommandObject<T> commandObject, boolean toReplica) -> T - Internal method handling the execution logic with retries and error handling
- execute(Connection connection, CommandObject<T> commandObject) -> T - Executes a command on a specific connection
- handleConnectionProblem(int attemptsLeft, int consecutiveConnectionFailures, Instant doneDeadline) -> boolean - Handles connection issues with backoff and slot cache renewal
- getBackoffSleepMillis(int attemptsLeft, Instant deadline) -> long - Calculates backoff sleep duration for retries
- sleep(long sleepMillis) -> void - Sleeps for the specified milliseconds, handling interruptions
